title: Aubry Set of Eikonal Hamilton-Jacobi Equations on Networks
abstract:
We extend the study of eikonal Hamilton-Jacobi equations posed on networks
performed by Siconolfi and Sorrentino (Anal. PDE, 2018) to a more general
setting. Their approach essentially exploits that such equations correspond to
discrete problems on an abstract underlying graph. However, a specific
condition they assume can be rather restricting in some settings, which
motivates the generalization we propose. We still get an Aubry set, which plays
the role of a uniqueness set for our problem and appears in the representation
of solutions. Exploiting it we establish a new comparison principle between
super and subsolutions to the equation.
